author: Deleted User
content: EIP-1153 was itself an alternative to EIP-2200 which ended up "winning"

author: Deleted User
content: but I think EIP-1153 brings more advantages than just being an alternative, and I suppose that is why it is being looked at again now

author: schone_wizard
content: Is the thinking for the merge still that the spec has to be frozen by February in order to not exceed a June bomb diffusion? Or is that not really true

author: timbeiko
content: There is probably some wiggle room, but that seems realistic. If you freeze in Feb, have clients in March, testnets in April, mainnet in May, roughly. None of these are exact, and if we found an issue at any stage weâ€™d probably delay.

author: timbeiko
content: Itâ€™s hard to predict, though, just because of unknown unknowns: best we can do is implement/test/break/fix things with as efficient of a cycle as possible ðŸ˜„

author: potuz
content: I'm hoping this schedule is not followed. When I hear things like having clients in March (two months from now) I get a cold sweat having some staked ETH. With this timeline there's less than a couple months to test on something that looks close enough to mainnet.  In my mind not having another  fork to postpone the bomb is suicidal
